Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:1: O ye who believe! Fulfil your indentures.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:2: O ye who believe! Profane not Allah’s monuments nor the Sacred Month nor the offerings nor the garlands, nor those repairing to the Sacred House, seeking the grace and pleasure of their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:3: Forbidden unto you (for food) are carrion and blood and swineflesh, and that which hath been dedicated unto any other than Allah, and the strangled, and the dead through beating, and the dead through falling from a height, and that which hath been killed by (the goring of) horns, and the devoured of wild beasts, saving that which ye make lawful (by the death-stroke), and that which hath been immolated unto idols.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:4: They ask thee (O Muhammad) what is made lawful for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:5: This day are (all) good things made lawful for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:6: O ye who believe! When ye rise up for prayer, wash you faces, and your hands up to the elbows, and lightly rub your heads and (wash) your feet up to the ankles.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:7: Remember Allah’s grace upon you and His covenant by which He bound you when ye said: We hear and we obey; And keep your duty to Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:8: O ye who believe! Be steadfast witnesses for Allah in equity, and let not hatred of any people seduce you that ye deal not justly.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:9: Allah hath promised those who believe and do good works: Theirs will be forgiveness and immense reward.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:10: And they who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, such are rightful owners of hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:11: O ye who believe! Remember Allah’s favour unto you, how a people were minded to stretch out their hands against you but He withheld their hands from you; and keep your duty to Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:12: Allah made a covenant of old with the Children of Israel and We raised among them twelve chieftains, and Allah said: Lo! I am with you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:13: And because of their breaking their covenant, We have cursed them and made hard their hearts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:14: And with those who say: "Lo! we are Christians," We made a covenant, but they forgot a part of that whereof they were admonished.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:15: O People of the Scripture! Now hath Our messenger come unto you, expounding unto you much of that which ye used to hide in the Scripture, and forgiving much.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:16: Whereby Allah guideth him who seeketh His good pleasure unto paths of peace.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:17: They indeed have disbelieved who say: Lo! Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:18: The Jews and Christians say: We are sons of Allah and His loved ones.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:19: O People of the Scripture! Now hath Our messenger come unto you to make things plain unto you after an interval (of cessation) of the messengers, lest ye should say: There came not unto us a messenger of cheer nor any warner.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:20: And (remember) when Moses said unto his people: O my people! Remember Allah’s favour unto you, how He placed among you prophets, and He made you kings, and gave you that (which) He gave not to any (other) of (His) creatures.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:21: O my people! Go into the holy land which Allah hath ordained for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:22: They said: O Moses! Lo! a giant people (dwell) therein and lo! we go not in till they go forth from thence.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:23: Then out spake two of those who feared (their Lord, men) unto whom Allah had been gracious: Enter in upon them by the gate, for if ye enter by it, lo! ye will be victorious.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:24: They said: O Moses! We will never enter (the land) while they are in it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:25: He said: My Lord! I have control of none but myself and my brother, so distinguish between us and the wrong-doing folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:26: (Their Lord) said: For this the land will surely be forbidden them for forty years that they will wander in the earth, bewildered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:27: But recite unto them with truth the tale of the two sons of Adam, how they offered each a sacrifice, and it was accepted from the one of them and it was not accepted from the other.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:28: Even if thou stretch out thy hand against me to kill me, I shall not stretch out my hand against thee to kill thee, lo! I fear Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:29: Lo! I would rather thou shouldst bear the punishment of the sin against me and thine own sin and become one of the owners of the fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:30: But (the other’s) mind imposed on him the killing of his brother, so he slew him and became one of the losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:31: Then Allah sent a raven scratching up the ground, to show him how to hide his brother’s naked corpse.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:32: For that cause We decreed for the Children of Israel that whosoever killeth a human being for other than manslaughter or corruption in the earth, it shall be as if he had killed all mankind, and whoso saveth the life of one, it shall be as if he had saved the life of all mankind.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:33: The only reward of those who make war upon Allah and His messenger and strive after corruption in the land will be that they will be killed or crucified, or have their hands and feet on alternate sides cut off, or will be expelled out of the land.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:34: Save those who repent before ye overpower them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:35: O ye who believe! Be mindful of your duty to Allah, and seek the way of approach unto Him, and strive in His way in order that ye may succeed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:36: As for those who disbelieve, lo! if all that is in the earth were theirs, and as much again therewith, to ransom them from the doom on the Day of Resurrection, it would not be accepted from them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:37: They will wish to come forth from the Fire, but they will not come forth from it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:38: As for the thief, both male and female, cut off their hands.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:39: But whoso repenteth after his wrongdoing and amendeth, lo! Allah will relent toward him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:40: Knowest thou not that unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth ? He punisheth whom He will, and forgiveth whom He will.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:41: O Messenger! Let not them grieve thee who vie one with another in the race to disbelief, of such as say with their mouths: "We believe," but their hearts believe not, and of the Jews: listeners for the sake of falsehood, listeners on behalf of other folk who come not unto thee, changing words from their context and saying: If this be given unto you, receive it, but if this be not given unto you, then beware! He whom Allah doometh unto sin, thou (by thine efforts) wilt avail him naught against Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:42: Listeners for the sake of falsehood! Greedy for illicit gain! If then they have recourse unto thee (Muhammad) judge between them or disclaim jurisdiction.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:43: How come they unto thee for judgment when they have the Torah, wherein Allah hath delivered judgment (for them) ? Yet even after that they turn away.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:44: Lo! We did reveal the Torah, wherein is guidance and a light, by which the prophets who surrendered (unto Allah) judged the Jews, and the rabbis and the priests (judged) by such of Allah’s Scripture as they were bidden to observe, and thereunto were they witnesses.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:45: And We prescribed for them therein: The life for the life, and the eye for the eye, and the nose for the nose, and the ear for the ear, and the tooth for the tooth, and for wounds retaliation.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:46: And We caused Jesus, son of Mary, to follow in their footsteps, confirming that which was (revealed) before him in the Torah, and We bestowed on him the Gospel wherein is guidance and a light, confirming that which was (revealed) before it in the Torah - a guidance and an admonition unto those who ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:47: Let the People of the Gospel judge by that which Allah hath revealed therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:48: And unto thee have We revealed the Scripture with the truth, confirming whatever Scripture was before it, and a watcher over it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:49: So judge between them by that which Allah hath revealed, and follow not their desires, but beware of them lest they seduce thee from some part of that which Allah hath revealed unto thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:50: Is it a judgment of the time of (pagan) ignorance that they are seeking ? Who is better than Allah for judgment to a people who have certainty (in their belief) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:51: O ye who believe! Take not the Jews and the Christians for friends.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:52: And thou seest those in whose heart is a disease race toward them, saying: We fear lest a change of fortune befall us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:53: Then will the believers say (unto the people of the Scripture): are these they who swore by Allah their most binding oaths that they were surely with you ? Their works have failed, and they have become the losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:54: O ye who believe! Whoso of you becometh a renegade from his religion, (know that in his stead) Allah will bring a people whom He loveth and who love Him, humble toward believers, stern toward disbelievers, striving in the way of Allah, and fearing not the blame of any blamer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:55: Your guardian can be only Allah; and His messenger and those who believe, who establish worship and pay the poordue, and bow down (in prayer).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:56: And whoso taketh Allah and His messenger and those who believe for guardian (will know that), lo! the party of Allah, they are the victorious.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:57: O Ye who believe! Choose not for guardians such of those who received the Scripture before you, and of the disbelievers, as make a jest and sport of your religion.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:58: And when ye call to prayer they take it for a jest and sport.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:59: Say: O People of the Scripture! Do ye blame us for aught else than that we believe in Allah and that which is revealed unto us and that which was revealed aforetime, and because most of you are evil-livers ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:60: Shall I tell thee of a worse (case) than theirs for retribution with Allah ? (Worse is the case of him) whom Allah hath cursed, him on whom His wrath hath fallen and of whose sort Allah hath turned some to apes and swine, and who serveth idols.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:61: When they come unto you (Muslims), they say: We believe; but they came in unbelief and they went out in the same; and Allah knoweth best what they were hiding.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:62: And thou seest many of them vying one with another in sin and transgression and their devouring of illicit gain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:63: Why do not the rabbis and the priests forbid their evil-speaking and their devouring of illicit gain ? Verily evil is their handiwork.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:64: The Jews say: Allah’s hand is fettered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:65: If only the People of the Scripture would believe and ward off (evil), surely We should remit their sins from them and surely We should bring them into Gardens of Delight.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:66: If they had observed the Torah and the Gospel and that which was revealed unto them from their Lord, they would surely have been nourished from above them and from beneath their feet.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:67: O Messenger! Make known that which hath been revealed unto thee from thy Lord, for if thou do it not, thou wilt not have conveyed His message.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:68: Say O People of the Scripture! Ye have naught (of guidance) till ye observe the Torah and the Gospel and that which was revealed unto you from your Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:69: Lo! those who believe, and those who are Jews, and Sabaeans, and Christians - Whosoever believeth in Allah and the Last Day and doeth right - there shall no fear come upon them neiither shall they grieve.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:70: We made a covenant of old with the Children of Israel and We sent unto them messengers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:71: They thought no harm would come of it, so they were wilfully blind and deaf.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:72: They surely disbelieve who say: Lo! Allah is the Messiah, son of Mary.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:73: They surely disbelieve who say: Lo! Allah is the third of three; when there is no God save the One God.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:74: Will they not rather turn unto Allah and seek forgiveness of Him ? For Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:75: The Messiah, son of Mary, was no other than a messenger, messengers (the like of whom) had passed away before him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:76: Say: Serve ye in place of Allah that which possesseth for you neither hurt nor use ? Allah it is Who is the Hearer, the Knower.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:77: Say: O People of the Scripture! Stress not in your religion other than the truth, and follow not the vain desires of folk who erred of old and led many astray, and erred from a plain road.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:78: Those of the Children of Israel who went astray were cursed by the tongue of David, and of Jesus, son of Mary.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:79: They restrained not one another from the wickedness they did.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:80: Thou seest many of them making friends with those who disbelieve.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:81: If they believed in Allah and the Prophet and that which is revealed unto him, they would not choose them for their friends.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:82: Thou wilt find the most vehement of mankind in hostility to those who believe (to be) the Jews and the idolaters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:83: When they listen to that which hath been revealed unto the messengers, thou seest their eyes overflow with tears because of their recognition of the Truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:84: How should we not believe in Allah and that which hath come unto us of the Truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:85: Allah hath rewarded them for that their saying - Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide for ever.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:86: But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, they are owners of hell-fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:87: O ye who believe! Forbid not the good things which Allah hath made lawful for you, and transgress not, Lo! Allah loveth not transgressors.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:88: Eat of that which Allah hath bestowed on you as food lawful and good, and keep your duty to Allah in Whom ye are believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:89: Allah will not take you to task for that which is unintentional in your oaths, but He will take you to task for the oaths which ye swear in earnest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:90: O ye who believe! Strong drink and games of chance and idols and divining arrows are only an infamy of Satan’s handiwork.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:91: Satan seeketh only to cast among you enmity and hatred by means of strong drink and games of chance, and to turn you from remembrance of Allah and from (His) worship.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:92: Obey Allah and obey the messenger, and beware! But if ye turn away, then know that the duty of Our messenger is only plain conveyance (of the message).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:93: There shall be no sin (imputed) unto those who believe and do good works for what they may have eaten (in the past).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:94: O ye who believe! Allah will surely try you somewhat (in the matter) of the game which ye take with your hands and your spears, that Allah may know him who feareth Him in secret.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:95: O ye who believe! Kill no wild game while ye are on the pilgrimage.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:96: To hunt and to eat the fish of the sea is made lawful for you, a provision for you and for seafarers; but to hunt on land is forbidden you so long as ye are on the pilgrimage.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:97: Allah hath appointed the Ka’bah, the Sacred House, a standard for mankind, and the Sacred Month and the offerings and the garlands.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:98: Know that Allah is severe in punishment, but that Allah (also) is Forgiving, Merciful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:99: The duty of the messenger is only to convey (the message).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:100: Say: The evil and the good are not alike even though the plenty of the evil attract thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:101: O ye who believe! Ask not of things which, if they were made unto you, would trouble you; but if ye ask of them when the Qur’an is being revealed, they will be made known unto you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:102: A folk before you asked (for such disclosures) and then disbelieved therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:103: Allah hath not appointed anything in the nature of a Bahirah or a Sa’ibah or a Wasilah or a Hami, but those who disbelieve invent a lie against Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:104: And when it is said unto them: Come unto that which Allah hath revealed and unto the messenger, they say: Enough for us is that wherein we found our fathers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:105: O ye who believe! Ye have charge of your own souls.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:106: O ye who believe! Let there be witnesses between you when death draweth nigh unto one of you, at the time of bequest - two witnesses, just men from among you, or two others from another tribe, in case ye are campaigning in the land and the calamity of death befall you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:107: But then, if it is afterwards ascertained that both of them merit (the suspicion of) sin, let two others take their place of those nearly concerned, and let them swear by Allah, (saying): Verily our testimony is truer than their testimony and we have not transgressed (the bounds of duty), for them indeed we should be of the evil-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:108: Thus it is more likely that they will bear true witness or fear that after their oaths the oaths (of others) will be taken.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:109: In the day when Allah gathereth together the messengers, and saith: What was your response (from mankind) ? they say: We have no knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:110: When Allah saith: O Jesus, son of Mary! Remember My favour unto thee and unto thy mother; how I strengthened thee with the holy Spirit, so that thou spakest unto mankind in the cradle as in maturity; and how I taught thee the Scripture and Wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel; and how thou didst shape of clay as it were the likeness of a bird by My permission, and didst blow upon it and it was a bird by My permission, and thou didst heal him who was born blind and the leper by My permission; and how thou didst raise the dead by My permission; and how I restrained the Children of Israel from (harming) thee when thou camest unto them with clear proofs, and those of them who disbelieved exclaimed: This is naught else than mere magic;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:111: And when I inspired the disciples, (saying): Believe in Me and in My messenger, they said: We believe.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:112: When the disciples said: O Jesus, son of Mary! Is thy Lord able to send down for us a table spread with food from heaven ? He said: Observe your duty to Allah, if ye are true believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:113: (They said:) We wish to eat thereof, that we may satisfy our hearts and know that thou hast spoken truth to us, and that thereof we may be witnesses.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:114: Jesus, son of Mary, said: O Allah, Lord of us! Send down for us a table spread with food from heaven, that it may be a feast for us, for the first of us and for the last of us, and a sign from Thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:115: Allah said: Lo! I send it down for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:116: And when Allah saith: O Jesus, son of Mary! Didst thou say unto mankind: Take me and my mother for two gods beside Allah ? he saith: Be glorified! It was not mine to utter that to which I had no right.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:117: I spake unto them only that which Thou commandedst me, (saying): Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:118: If Thou punish them, lo! they are Thy slaves, and if Thou forgive them (lo! they are Thy slaves).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:119: Allah saith: This is a day in which their truthfulness profiteth the truthful, for theirs are Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they are secure for ever, Allah taking pleasure in them and they in Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 5:120: Unto Allah belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and whatsoever is therein, and He is Able to do all things.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:1: O ye who believe! fulfil (all) obligations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:2: O ye who believe! Violate not the sanctity of the symbols of Allah, nor of the sacred month, nor of the animals brought for sacrifice, nor the garlands that mark out such animals, nor the people resorting to the sacred house, seeking of the bounty and good pleasure of their Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:3: Forbidden to you (for food) are: dead meat, blood, the flesh of swine, and that on which hath been invoked the name of other than Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:4: They ask thee what is lawful to them (as food).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:5: This day are (all) things good and pure made lawful unto you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:6: O ye who believe! when ye prepare for prayer, wash your faces, and your hands (and arms) to the elbows; Rub your heads (with water); and (wash) your feet to the ankles.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:7: And call in remembrance the favour of Allah unto you, and His covenant, which He ratified with you, when ye said: "We hear and we obey": And fear Allah, for Allah knoweth well the secrets of your hearts.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:8: O ye who believe! stand out firmly for Allah, as witnesses to fair dealing, and let not the hatred of others to you make you swerve to wrong and depart from justice.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:9: To those who believe and do deeds of righteousness hath Allah promised forgiveness and a great reward.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:10: Those who reject faith and deny our signs will be companions of Hell-fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:11: O ye who believe! Call in remembrance the favour of Allah unto you when certain men formed the design to stretch out their hands against you, but ((Allah)) held back their hands from you: so fear Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:12: Allah did aforetime take a covenant from the Children of Israel, and we appointed twelve captains among them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:13: But because of their breach of their covenant, We cursed them, and made their hearts grow hard; they change the words from their (right) places and forget a good part of the message that was sent them, nor wilt thou cease to find them- barring a few - ever bent on (new) deceits: but forgive them, and overlook (their misdeeds): for Allah loveth those who are kind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:14: From those, too, who call themselves Christians, We did take a covenant, but they forgot a good part of the message that was sent them: so we estranged them, with enmity and hatred between the one and the other, to the day of judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:15: O people of the Book! There hath come to you our Messenger, revealing to you much that ye used to hide in the Book, and passing over much (that is now unnecessary).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:16: Wherewith Allah guideth all who seek His good pleasure to ways of peace and safety, and leadeth them out of darkness, by His will, unto the light,- guideth them to a path that is straight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:17: In blasphemy indeed are those that say that Allah is Christ the son of Mary.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:18: (Both) the Jews and the Christians say: "We are sons of Allah, and his beloved.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:19: O People of the Book! Now hath come unto you, making (things) clear unto you, Our Messenger, after the break in (the series of) our apostles, lest ye should say: "There came unto us no bringer of glad tidings and no warner (from evil)": But now hath come unto you a bringer of glad tidings and a warner (from evil).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:20: Remember Moses said to his people: "O my people! Call in remembrance the favour of Allah unto you, when He produced prophets among you, made you kings, and gave you what He had not given to any other among the peoples.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:21: "O my people! Enter the holy land which Allah hath assigned unto you, and turn not back ignominiously, for then will ye be overthrown, to your own ruin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:22: They said: "O Moses! In this land are a people of exceeding strength: Never shall we enter it until they leave it: if (once) they leave, then shall we enter.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:24: They said: "O Moses! while they remain there, never shall we be able to enter, to the end of time.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:25: He said: "O my Lord! I have power only over myself and my brother: so separate us from this rebellious people!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:26: Allah said: "Therefore will the land be out of their reach for forty years: In distraction will they wander through the land: But sorrow thou not over these rebellious people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:27: Recite to them the truth of the story of the two sons of Adam.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:28: "If thou dost stretch thy hand against me, to slay me, it is not for me to stretch my hand against thee to slay thee: for I do fear Allah, the cherisher of the worlds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:29: "For me, I intend to let thee draw on thyself my sin as well as thine, for thou wilt be among the companions of the fire, and that is the reward of those who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:30: The (selfish) soul of the other led him to the murder of his brother: he murdered him, and became (himself) one of the lost ones.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:31: Then Allah sent a raven, who scratched the ground, to show him how to hide the shame of his brother.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:32: On that account: We ordained for the Children of Israel that if any one slew a person - unless it be for murder or for spreading mischief in the land - it would be as if he slew the whole people: and if any one saved a life, it would be as if he saved the life of the whole people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:33: The punishment of those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger, and strive with might and main for mischief through the land is: execution, or crucifixion, or the cutting off of hands and feet from opposite sides, or exile from the land: that is their disgrace in this world, and a heavy punishment is theirs in the Hereafter;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:34: Except for those who repent before they fall into your power: in that case, know that Allah is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:35: O ye who believe! Do your duty to Allah, seek the means of approach unto Him, and strive with might and main in his cause: that ye may prosper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:36: As to those who reject Faith,- if they had everything on earth, and twice repeated, to give as ransom for the penalty of the Day of Judgment, it would never be accepted of them, theirs would be a grievous penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:37: Their wish will be to get out of the Fire, but never will they get out therefrom: their penalty will be one that endures.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:38: As to the thief, Male or female, cut off his or her hands: a punishment by way of example, from Allah, for their crime: and Allah is Exalted in power.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:39: But if the thief repents after his crime, and amends his conduct, Allah turneth to him in forgiveness; for Allah is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:40: Knowest thou not that to Allah (alone) belongeth the dominion of the heavens and the earth? He punisheth whom He pleaseth, and He forgiveth whom He pleaseth: and Allah hath power over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:42: (They are fond of) listening to falsehood, of devouring anything forbidden.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:43: But why do they come to thee for decision, when they have (their own) law before them?- therein is the (plain) command of Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:44: It was We who revealed the law (to Moses): therein was guidance and light.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:45: We ordained therein for them: "Life for life, eye for eye, nose or nose, ear for ear, tooth for tooth, and wounds equal for equal.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:46: And in their footsteps We sent Jesus the son of Mary, confirming the Law that had come before him: We sent him the Gospel: therein was guidance and light, and confirmation of the Law that had come before him: a guidance and an admonition to those who fear Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:47: Let the people of the Gospel judge by what Allah hath revealed therein.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:48: To thee We sent the Scripture in truth, confirming the scripture that came before it, and guarding it in safety: so judge between them by what Allah hath revealed, and follow not their vain desires, diverging from the Truth that hath come to thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:49: And this (He commands): Judge thou between them by what Allah hath revealed, and follow not their vain desires, but beware of them lest they beguile thee from any of that (teaching) which Allah hath sent down to thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:50: Do they then seek after a judgment of (the days of) ignorance? But who, for a people whose faith is assured, can give better judgment than Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:51: O ye who believe! take not the Jews and the Christians for your friends and protectors: They are but friends and protectors to each other.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:52: Those in whose hearts is a disease - thou seest how eagerly they run about amongst them, saying: "We do fear lest a change of fortune bring us disaster.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:53: And those who believe will say: "Are these the men who swore their strongest oaths by Allah, that they were with you?" All that they do will be in vain, and they will fall into (nothing but) ruin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:54: O ye who believe! if any from among you turn back from his Faith, soon will Allah produce a people whom He will love as they will love Him,- lowly with the believers, mighty against the rejecters, fighting in the way of Allah, and never afraid of the reproaches of such as find fault.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:55: Your (real) friends are (no less than) Allah, His Messenger, and the (fellowship of) believers,- those who establish regular prayers and regular charity, and they bow down humbly (in worship).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:56: As to those who turn (for friendship) to Allah, His Messenger, and the (fellowship of) believers,- it is the fellowship of Allah that must certainly triumph.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:57: O ye who believe! take not for friends and protectors those who take your religion for a mockery or sport,- whether among those who received the Scripture before you, or among those who reject Faith; but fear ye Allah, if ye have faith (indeed).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:58: When ye proclaim your call to prayer they take it (but) as mockery and sport; that is because they are a people without understanding.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:59: Say: "O people of the Book! Do ye disapprove of us for no other reason than that we believe in Allah, and the revelation that hath come to us and that which came before (us), and (perhaps) that most of you are rebellious and disobedient?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:60: Say: "Shall I point out to you something much worse than this, (as judged) by the treatment it received from Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:61: When they come to thee, they say: "We believe": but in fact they enter with a mind against Faith, and they go out with the same but Allah knoweth fully all that they hide.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:62: Many of them dost thou see, racing each other in sin and rancour, and their eating of things forbidden.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:63: Why do not the rabbis and the doctors of Law forbid them from their (habit of) uttering sinful words and eating things forbidden? Evil indeed are their works.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:64: The Jews say: "(Allah)’s hand is tied up.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:65: If only the People of the Book had believed and been righteous, We should indeed have blotted out their iniquities and admitted them to gardens of bliss.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:66: If only they had stood fast by the Law, the Gospel, and all the revelation that was sent to them from their Lord, they would have enjoyed happiness from every side.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:68: Say: "O People of the Book! ye have no ground to stand upon unless ye stand fast by the Law, the Gospel, and all the revelation that has come to you from your Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:69: Those who believe (in the Qur’an), those who follow the Jewish (scriptures), and the Sabians and the Christians,- any who believe in Allah and the Last Day, and work righteousness,- on them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:70: We took the covenant of the Children of Israel and sent them apostles, every time, there came to them an apostle with what they themselves desired not - some (of these) they called impostors, and some they (go so far as to) slay.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:71: They thought there would be no trial (or punishment); so they became blind and deaf; yet Allah (in mercy) turned to them; yet again many of them became blind and deaf.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:72: They do blaspheme who say: "(Allah) is Christ the son of Mary.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:73: They do blaspheme who say: Allah is one of three in a Trinity: for there is no god except One Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:74: Why turn they not to Allah, and seek His forgiveness? For Allah is Oft- forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:75: Christ the son of Mary was no more than an apostle; many were the apostles that passed away before him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:76: Say: "Will ye worship, besides Allah, something which hath no power either to harm or benefit you? But Allah,- He it is that heareth and knoweth all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:77: Say: "O people of the Book! exceed not in your religion the bounds (of what is proper), trespassing beyond the truth, nor follow the vain desires of people who went wrong in times gone by,- who misled many, and strayed (themselves) from the even way.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:78: Curses were pronounced on those among the Children of Israel who rejected Faith, by the tongue of David and of Jesus the son of Mary: because they disobeyed and persisted in excesses.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:79: Nor did they (usually) forbid one another the iniquities which they committed: evil indeed were the deeds which they did.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:80: Thou seest many of them turning in friendship to the Unbelievers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:81: If only they had believed in Allah, in the Messenger, and in what hath been revealed to him, never would they have taken them for friends and protectors, but most of them are rebellious wrong-doers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:82: Strongest among men in enmity to the believers wilt thou find the Jews and Pagans; and nearest among them in love to the believers wilt thou find those who say, "We are Christians": because amongst these are men devoted to learning and men who have renounced the world, and they are not arrogant.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:83: And when they listen to the revelation received by the Messenger, thou wilt see their eyes overflowing with tears, for they recognise the truth: they pray: "Our Lord! we believe; write us down among the witnesses.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:84: "What cause can we have not to believe in Allah and the truth which has come to us, seeing that we long for our Lord to admit us to the company of the righteous?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:85: And for this their prayer hath Allah rewarded them with gardens, with rivers flowing underneath,- their eternal home.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:86: But those who reject Faith and belie our Signs,- they shall be companions of Hell-fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:87: O ye who believe! make not unlawful the good things which Allah hath made lawful for you, but commit no excess: for Allah loveth not those given to excess.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:88: Eat of the things which Allah hath provided for you, lawful and good; but fear Allah, in Whom ye believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:89: Allah will not call you to account for what is futile in your oaths, but He will call you to account for your deliberate oaths: for expiation, feed ten indigent persons, on a scale of the average for the food of your families; or clothe them; or give a slave his freedom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:90: O ye who believe! Intoxicants and gambling, (dedication of) stones, and (divination by) arrows, are an abomination,- of Satan’s handwork: eschew such (abomination), that ye may prosper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:91: Satan’s plan is (but) to excite enmity and hatred between you, with intoxicants and gambling, and hinder you from the remembrance of Allah, and from prayer: will ye not then abstain?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:92: Obey Allah, and obey the Messenger, and beware (of evil): if ye do turn back, know ye that it is Our Messenger.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:93: On those who believe and do deeds of righteousness there is no blame for what they ate (in the past), when they guard themselves from evil, and believe, and do deeds of righteousness,- (or) again, guard themselves from evil and believe,- (or) again, guard themselves from evil and do good.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:94: O ye who believe! Allah doth but make a trial of you in a little matter of game well within reach of your hands and your lances, that He may test who feareth him unseen: any who transgress thereafter, will have a grievous penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:95: O ye who believe! Kill not game while in the sacred precincts or in pilgrim garb.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:96: Lawful to you is the pursuit of water-game and its use for food,- for the benefit of yourselves and those who travel; but forbidden is the pursuit of land-game;- as long as ye are in the sacred precincts or in pilgrim garb.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:97: Allah made the Ka’ba, the Sacred House, an asylum of security for men, as also the Sacred Months, the animals for offerings, and the garlands that mark them: That ye may know that Allah hath knowledge of what is in the heavens and on earth and that Allah is well acquainted with all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:98: Know ye that Allah is strict in punishment and that Allah is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:100: Say: "Not equal are things that are bad and things that are good, even though the abundance of the bad may dazzle thee; so fear Allah, O ye that understand; that (so) ye may prosper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:101: O ye who believe! Ask not questions about things which, if made plain to you, may cause you trouble.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:102: Some people before you did ask such questions, and on that account lost their faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:103: It was not Allah who instituted (superstitions like those of) a slit-ear she- camel, or a she-camel let loose for free pasture, or idol sacrifices for twin-births in animals, or stallion-camels freed from work: It is blasphemers who invent a lie against Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:104: When it is said to them: "Come to what Allah hath revealed; come to the Messenger.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:105: O ye who believe! Guard your own souls: If ye follow (right) guidance, no hurt can come to you from those who stray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:106: O ye who believe! When death approaches any of you, (take) witnesses among yourselves when making bequests,- two just men of your own (brotherhood) or others from outside if ye are journeying through the earth, and the chance of death befalls you (thus).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:107: But if it gets known that these two were guilty of the sin (of perjury), let two others stand forth in their places,- nearest in kin from among those who claim a lawful right: let them swear by Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:108: That is most suitable: that they may give the evidence in its true nature and shape, or else they would fear that other oaths would be taken after their oaths.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:109: One day will Allah gather the apostles together, and ask: "What was the response ye received (from men to your teaching)?" They will say: "We have no knowledge: it is Thou Who knowest in full all that is hidden.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:110: Then will Allah say: "O Jesus the son of Mary! Recount My favour to thee and to thy mother.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:111: "And behold! I inspired the disciples to have faith in Me and Mine Messenger.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:112: Behold! the disciples, said: "O Jesus the son of Mary! can thy Lord send down to us a table set (with viands) from heaven?" Said Jesus: "Fear Allah, if ye have faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:113: They said: "We only wish to eat thereof and satisfy our hearts, and to know that thou hast indeed told us the truth; and that we ourselves may be witnesses to the miracle.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:114: Said Jesus the son of Mary: "O Allah our Lord! Send us from heaven a table set (with viands), that there may be for us - for the first and the last of us - a solemn festival and a sign from thee; and provide for our sustenance, for thou art the best Sustainer (of our needs).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:115: Allah said: "I will send it down unto you: But if any of you after that resisteth faith, I will punish him with a penalty such as I have not inflicted on any one among all the peoples.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:116: And behold! Allah will say: "O Jesus the son of Mary! Didst thou say unto men, worship me and my mother as gods in derogation of Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:117: "Never said I to them aught except what Thou didst command me to say, to wit, ’worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord’; and I was a witness over them whilst I dwelt amongst them; when Thou didst take me up Thou wast the Watcher over them, and Thou art a witness to all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:118: "If Thou dost punish them, they are Thy servant: If Thou dost forgive them, Thou art the Exalted in power, the Wise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:119: Allah will say: "This is a day on which the truthful will profit from their truth: theirs are gardens, with rivers flowing beneath,- their eternal Home: Allah well-pleased with them, and they with Allah.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 5:120: To Allah doth belong the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and all that is therein, and it is He Who hath power over all things.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:2: O believers, profane not God’s waymarks nor the holy month, neither the offering, nor the necklaces, nor those repairing to the Holy House seeking from their Lord bounty and good pleasure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:3: Forbidden to you are carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, what has been hallowed to other than God, the beast strangled; the beast beaten down, the beast fallen to death, the beast gored, and that devoured by beasts of prey - excepting that you have sacrificed duly -- as also things sacrificed to idols, and partition by the divining arrows; that is ungodliness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:4: They will question thee what is permitted them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:5: Today the good things are permitted you, and the food of those who were given the Book is permitted to you, and permitted to them is your food; Likewise believing women in wedlock, and in wedlock women of them who were given the Book before you if you give them their wages, in wedlock and not in licence, or as taking lovers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:6: O believers, when you stand up to pray wash your faces, and your hands up to the elbows, and wipe your heads, and your feet up to the ankles.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:7: And remember God’s blessing upon you, and His compact which He made with you when you said, ’We have heard and we obey.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:8: O believers, be you securers of justice, witnesses for God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:9: God has promised those that believe, and do deeds of righteousness; they shall have; forgiveness and a mighty wage.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:10: And the unbelievers, who cried lies to Our signs -- they shall be the inhabitants of Hell.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:11: O believers, remember God’s blessing upon you, when a certain people purposed to stretch against you their hands, and He restrained their hands from you; and fear God; and in God let the believers put all their trust.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:12: God took compact with the Children of Israel; and We raised up from among them twelve chieftains.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:13: So for their breaking their compact We cursed them and made their hearts hard, they perverting words from their meanings; and they have forgotten a portion of that they were reminded of; and thou wilt never cease to light upon some act of treachery on their part, except a few of them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:14: And with those who say ’We are Christians’ We took compact; and they have forgotten a portion of that they were reminded of.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:15: People of the Book, now there has come to you Our Messenger, making clear to you many things you have been concealing of the Book, and effacing many things.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:16: whereby God guides whosoever follows His good pleasure in the ways of peace, and brings them forth from the shadows into the light by His leave; and He guides them to a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:17: They are unbelievers who say, ’God is the Messiah, Mary’s son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:18: Say the Jews and Christians, ’We are the sons of God, and His beloved ones.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:19: People of the Book, now there has come to you Our Messenger, making things clear to you, upon an interval between the Messengers lest you should say, ’There has not come to us any bearer of good tidings, neither any warner.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:20: And when Moses said to his people, ’O my people, remember God’s blessing upon you, when He appointed among you Prophets, and appointed you kings, and gave you such as He had not given to any being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:21: O my people, enter the Holy Land which God has prescribed for you, and turn not back in your traces, to turn about losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:22: They said, ’Moses, there are people in.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:23: Said two men of those that feared God whom God had blessed, ’Enter against them the gate! When you enter it, you will be victors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:24: They said, ’Moses, we will never enter it so long as they are in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:25: He said, ’O my Lord, I rule no one except myself and my brother.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:26: Said He, ’Then it shall be forbidden them for forty years, while they are wandering in the earth; so grieve not for the people of the ungodly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:27: And recite thou to them the story of the two sons of Adam truthfully, when they offered a sacrifice, and it was accepted of one of them, and not accepted of the other.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:28: ’Yet if thou stretchest out thy hand against me, to slay me, I will not stretch out my hand against thee, to slay thee; I fear God, the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:29: I desire that thou shouldest be laden with my sin and thy sin, and so become an inhabitant of the Fire; that is the recompense of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:30: Then his soul prompted him to slay his brother, and he slew him, and became one of the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:31: Then God sent forth a raven, scratching into the earth, to show him how he might conceal the vile body of his brother.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:32: Therefore We prescribed for the Children of Israel that whoso slays a soul not to retaliate for a soul slain, nor for corruption done in the land, shall be as if he had slain mankind altogether; and whoso gives life to a soul, shall be as if he ha given life to mankind altogether.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:33: This is the recompense of those who fight against God and His Messenger, and hasten about the earth, to do corruption there: they shall be slaughtered, or crucified, or their hands and feet shall alternately be struck off; or they shall be banished from the land.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:34: except for such as repent, before you have power over them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:35: O believers, fear God, and seek the means to come to Him, and struggle in His way; haply you will prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:36: The unbelievers, though they possessed all that is in the earth, and the like of it with it, to ransom themselves from the chastisement of the Day of Resurrection thereby, it would not be accepted of them; for them awaits a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:37: They will desire to come forth from the Fire, but they will not come forth from it; for them awaits a lasting chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:38: And the thief, male and female: cut off the hands of both, as a recompense for what they have earned, and a punishment exemplary from God; God is All-mighty, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:39: But whoso repents, after his evildoing, and makes amends, God will turn towards him; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:40: Knowest thou not that to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? He chastises whom He will, and forgives whom He will; and God is powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:41: O Messenger, let them not grieve thee that vie with one another in unbelief, such men as say with their mouths ’We believe’ but their hearts believe not; and the Jews who listen to falsehood, listen to other folk, who have not come to thee, perverting words from their meanings, saying, ’If you are given this, then take it; if you are not given it, beware!’ Whomsoever God desires to try, thou canst not avail him anything with God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:42: who listen to falsehood, and consume the unlawful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:43: Yet how will they make thee their judge seeing they have the Torah, wherein is God’s judgment, then thereafter turn their backs? They are not believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:44: Surely We sent down the Torah, wherein is guidance and light; thereby the Prophets who had surrendered themselves gave judgment for those of Jewry, as did the masters and the rabbis, following such portion of God’s Book as they were given to keep and were witnesses to.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:45: And therein We prescribed for them: ’A life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and for wounds retaliation’; but whosoever forgoes it as a freewill offering, that shall be for him an expiation.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:46: And We sent, following in their footsteps, Jesus son of Mary, confirming the Torah before him and We gave to him the Gospel, wherein is guidance and light, and confirming the Torah before it, as a guidance and an admonition unto the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:47: So let the People of the Gospel judge according to what God has sent down therein.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:48: And We have sent down to thee the Book with the truth, confirming the Book that was before it, and assuring it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:49: And judge between them according to what God has sent down, and do not follow their caprices, and beware of them lest they tempt thee away from any of what God has sent down to thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:50: Is it the judgment of pagandom then that they are seeking? Yet who is fairer in judgment than God, for a people having sure faith?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:51: O believers, take not Jews and Christians as friends; they are friends of each other.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:52: Yet thou seest those in whose hearts is sickness vying with one another to come to them, saying, ’We fear lest a turn of fortune should smite us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:53: and the believers will say, ’What, are these the ones who swore by God most earnest oaths that they were with you? Their works have failed now they are losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:54: O believers, whosoever of you turns from his religion, God will assuredly bring a people He loves, and who love Him, humble towards the believers, disdainful towards the unbelievers, men who struggle in the path of God, not fearing the reproach of any reproacher.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:55: Your friend is only God, and His Messenger, and the believers who perform the prayer and pay the alms, and bow them down.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:56: Whoso makes God his friend, and His Messenger, and the believers -- the party of God, they are the victors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:57: O believers, take not as your friends those of them, who were given the Book before you, and the unbelievers, who take your religion in mockery and as a sport -- and fear God, if you are believers --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:58: and when you call to prayer, take it in mockery and as a sport; that is because they are a people who have no understanding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:59: Say: ’People of the Book, do you blame us for any other cause than that we believe in God, and what has been sent down to us, and what was sent down before, and that most of you are ungodly?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:60: : ’Shall I tell you of a recompense with God, worse than that? Whomsoever God has cursed, and with whom He is wroth, and made some of them apes and swine, and worshippers of idols -- they are worse situated, and have gone further astray from the right way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:61: When they come to you, they say, ’We believe’; but they have entered in unbelief, and so they have departed in it; God knows very well what they were hiding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:62: Thou seest many of them vying in sin and enmity, and how they consume the unlawful; evil is the thing they have been doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:63: Why do the masters and the rabbis not forbid them to utter sin, and consume the unlawful? Evil is the thing they have been working.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:64: The Jews have said, ’God’s hand is fettered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:65: But had the People of the Book believed and been godfearing, We would have acquitted them of their evil deeds, and admitted them to Gardens of Bliss.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:66: Had they performed the Torah and the Gospel, and what was sent down to them from their Lord, they would have.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:67: O Messenger, deliver that which has been sent down to thee from thy Lord; for if thou dost not, thou wilt not have delivered His Message.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:68: Say: ’People of the Book, you do not stand on anything, until you perform the Torah and the Gospel, and what was sent down to you from your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:69: Surely they that believe, and those of Jewry, and the Sabaeans, and those Christians, whosoever believes in God and the Last Day, and works righteousness -- no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:70: And We took compact with the Children of Israel, and We sent Messengers to them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:71: And they supposed there should be no trial; but blind they were, and deaf.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:72: They are unbelievers who say, ’God is the Messiah, Mary’s son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:73: They are unbelievers who say, ’God is the Third of Three.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:74: Will they not turn to God and pray His forgiveness? God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:75: The Messiah, son of Mary, was only a Messenger; Messengers before him passed away; his mother was a just woman; they both ate food.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:76: Say: ’Do you serve, apart from God, that which cannot hurt or profit you? God is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:77: Say: ’People of the Book, go not beyond the bounds in your religion, other than the truth, and follow not the caprices of a people who went astray before, and led astray many, and now again have gone astray from the right way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:78: Cursed were the unbelievers of the Children of Israel by the tongue of David, and Jesus, Mary’s son; that, for their rebelling and their transgression.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:79: They forbade not one another any dishonour that they committed; surely evil were the things they did.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:80: Thou seest many of them making unbelievers their friends.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:81: Yet had they believed in God and the Prophet and what has been sent down to him, they would not have taken them as friends; but many of them are ungodly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:82: Thou wilt surely find the most hostile of men to the believers are the Jews and the idolaters; and thou wilt surely find the nearest of them in love to the believers are those who say ’We are Christians’; that, because some of them are priests and monks, and they wax not proud;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:83: and when they hear what has been sent down to the Messenger, thou seest their eyes overflow with tears because of the truth they recognize.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:84: Why should we not believe in God and the truth that has come to us, and be eager that our Lord should admit us with the righteous people?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:85: And God rewards them for what they say with gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever; that is the recompense of the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:86: But those who disbelieve, and cry lies to Our signs -- they are the inhabitants of Hell.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:87: O believers, forbid not such good things as God has permitted you; and transgress not; God loves not transgressors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:88: Eat of what God has provided you lawful and good; and fear God, in whom you are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:89: God will not take you to task for a slip in your oaths; but He will take you to task for such bonds as you have made by oaths, whereof the expiation is to feed ten poor persons with the average of the food you serve to your families, or to clothe them, or to set free a slave; or if any finds not the means, let him fast for three days.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:90: O believers, wine and arrow-shuffling, idols and divining-arrows are an abomination, some of Satan’s work; so avoid it; haply So you will prosper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:91: Satan only desires to precipitate enmity and hatred between you in regard to wine and arrow-shuffling, and to bar you from the remembrance of God, and from prayer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:92: And obey God and obey the Messenger, and beware; but if you turn your backs, then know that it is only for Our Messenger to deliver the Message Manifest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:93: There is no fault in those who believe and do deeds of righteousness what they may eat, if they are godfearing, and believe, and do deeds of righteousness, and then are godfearing and believe, and then are godfearing and do good; God loves the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:94: O believers, God will surely try you with something of the game that your hands and lances attain, that God may know who fears Him in the Unseen.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:95: O believers, slay not the game while you are in pilgrim sanctity; whosoever of you slays it wilfully, there shall be recompense -- the like of what he has slain, in flocks as shall be judged by two men of equity among you, an offering to reach the Kaaba; or expiation -- food for poor persons or the equivalent of that in fasting, so that he may taste the mischief of his action.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:96: Permitted to you is the game of the sea and the food of it, as a provision for you and for the journeyers; but forbidden to you is the game of the land, so long as you remain in pilgrim sanctity; and fear God, unto whom you shall be mustered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:97: God has appointed the Kaaba, the Holy House, as an establishment for men, and the holy month; the offering, and the necklaces -- that, that you may know that God knows all that is in the heavens and in the earth; and that God has knowledge of everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:98: Know God is terrible in retribution, and God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:99: It is only for the Messenger to deliver the Message; and God knows what you reveal and what you hide.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:100: Say: ’The corrupt and the good are not equal, though the abundance of the corrupt please thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:101: O believers, question not concerning things which, if they were revealed to you, would vex you; yet if you question concerning them when the Koran is being sent down, they will be revealed to you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:102: A people before you questioned concerning them, then disbelieved in them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:103: God has not appointed cattle dedicated to idols, such as Bahira, Sa’iba, Wasila, Hami; but the unbelievers forge against God falsehood, and most of them have no understanding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:104: And when it is said to them, ’Come now to what God has sent down, and the Messenger, they say, ’Enough for us is what we found our fathers doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:105: O believers, look after your own souls.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:106: O believers, the testimony between you when any of you is visited by death, at the bequeathing, shall be two men of equity among you; or two others from another folk, if you are journeying in the land and the affliction of death befalls you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:107: But if it be discovered that both of them have merited the accusation of any sin, then two others shall stand in their place, these being the nearest of those most concerned, and they shall swear by God, ’Our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed, for then we would assuredly be among the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:108: So it is likelier that they will bear testimony in proper form, or else they will be afraid that after their oaths, oaths may be rebutted.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:109: The day when God shall gather the Messengers, and say, ’What answer were you given?’ They shall say, ’We have no knowledge; Thou art the Knower of the things unseen.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:110: When God said, ’Jesus Son of Mary, remember My blessing upon thee and upon thy mother, when I confirmed thee with the Holy Spirit, to speak to men in the cradle, and of age; and when I taught thee the Book, the Wisdom, the Torah, the Gospel; and when thou createst out of clay, by My leave, as the likeness of a bird, and thou breathest into it, and it is a bird, by My leave; and thou healest the blind and the leper by My leave, and thou bringest the dead forth by My leave; and when restrained from thee the Children of Israel when thou camest unto them with the clear signs, and the unbelievers among them said, "This is nothing but sorcery manifest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:111: And when I inspired the Apostles: "Believe in Me and My Messenger"; they said, "We believe; witness Thou our submission.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:112: And when the Apostles said, ’O Jesus son of Mary, is thy Lord able to send down on us a Table out of heaven?’ He said, ’Fear you God, if you are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:113: They said, ’We desire that we should eat of it and our hearts be at rest; and that we may know that thou hast spoken true to us, and that we may be among its witnesses.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:114: Said Jesus son of Mary, ’O God, our Lord, send down upon us a Table out of heaven, that shall be for us a festival, the first and last of us, and a sign from Thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:115: God said, ’Verily I do send it down on you; whoso of you hereafter disbelieves, verily I shall chastise him with a chastisement wherewith I chastise no other being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:116: And when God said, ’O Jesus son of Mary, didst thou say unto men, "Take me and my mother as gods, apart from God"?’ He said, ’To Thee be glory! It is not mine to say what I have no right to.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:117: I only said to them what Thou didst command me: "Serve God, my Lord and your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:118: If Thou chastisest them, they are Thy servants; if Thou forgivest them, Thou art the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:119: God said, ’This is the day the truthful shall be profited by their truthfulness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 5:120: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is in them, and He is powerful over everything.

Muhammad Asad.verse 5:1: O YOU who have attained to faith! Be true to your covenants! Lawful to you is the [flesh of every] beast that feeds on plants, save what is mentioned to you :
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:2: but you are not allowed to hunt while you are in the state of pilgrimage.
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:3: O you who have attained to faith! Offend not against the symbols set up by God, nor against the sacred month [of pilgrimage], nor against the garlanded offerings, nor against those who flock to the Inviolable Temple, seeking favour with their Sustainer and His goodly acceptance; and
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:4: after your pilgrimage is over are you free to hunt.
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:5: FORBIDDEN to you is carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and that over which any name other than God’s has been invoked, and the animal that has been strangled, or beaten to death, or killed by a fall, or gored to death, or savaged by a beast of prey, save that which you
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:6: may have slaughtered while it was still alive; and [forbidden to you is] all that has been slaughtered on idolatrous altars.
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:7: They will ask thee as to what is lawful to them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:8: Today, all the good things of life have been made lawful to you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:9: O YOU who have attained to faith! When you are about to pray, wash your face, and your hands and arms up to the elbows, and pass your
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:10: hands lightly over your head, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:11: your feet up to the ankles And if you are in a state requiring total ablution, purify yourselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 5:13: remember the blessings which God has bestowed upon you, and the solemn pledge by which He bound you to Himself when you said, "We have heard, and we pay heed.
