Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:1: O you who believe, fulfill the contracts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:2: O you who believe, do not violate (the sanctity) of the Marks of Allah, nor of the sacred month, nor of the sacrificial animal, nor of the garlands, 6 nor of those proceeding to the Sacred House, seeking the grace of their Lord and (His) Pleasure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:3: Prohibited for you are: carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, and those upon which (a name) other than that of Allah has been invoked (at the time of slaughter), animal killed by strangulation, or killed by a blow, or by a fall, or by goring, or that which is eaten by a beast unless you have properly slaughtered it; and that which has been slaughtered before the idols, and that you determine shares through the arrows.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:4: They ask you as to what has been made lawful for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:5: This day, good things have been made lawful for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:6: O you who believe, when you rise for Salāh, (prayer) wash your faces and your hands up to the elbows, and make MasH (wiping by hands) of your heads and (wash) your feet up to the ankles.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:7: Remember Allah’s favour upon you and His covenant that He has taken from you when you said, “We have listened and obeyed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:8: O you who believe, be steadfast for (obeying the commands of) Allah, (and) witnesses for justice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:9: Allah has promised those who believe and do good deeds: For them there is forgiveness and a great reward.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:10: Those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - they are the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:11: O you who believe, remember Allah’s favour upon you, when some people planned to lay their hands on you, and He kept their hands away from you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:12: Allah has made the Children of Israel take a pledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:13: So, because they broke their pledge, We cursed them and made their hearts hardened.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:14: And from those who say, “We are Christians,” We took a pledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:15: O people of the Book, there has come to you Our Messenger disclosing to you much of what you have been concealing of the Book, while He overlooks much.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:16: with it Allah guides those who follow His pleasure to the pathways of peace, and brings them out, by His will, from the depths of darkness into the light, and guides them to a straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:17: Certainly, infidels are those who say, “God is the MasīH, son of Maryam (Jesus son of Mary).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:18: The Jews and the Christians say, “We are the sons of Allah and His favourites.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:19: O people of the Book, Our Messenger has come to you making things clear to you after a gap between Messengers, lest you were to say, “There has not come to us a bearer of good news, and a warner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:20: (Recall) when Mūsā said to his people, “O my people, remember the blessing of Allah upon you when He made prophets from among you, made you kings and gave you what He did not give to anyone in the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:21: O my people, enter the Holy Land which Allah has destined for you, and do not turn back, lest you should turn losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:22: They said, “O Mūsā, there is a nation of tyrants over there, and we shall never enter it until they get out of it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:23: Said two men from among the God-fearing, on whom Allah had bestowed His favour, “Enter the gate (charging) upon them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:24: They said, “O Mūsā, we shall never enter it, in any case, so long as they are there.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:25: He said, “O my Lord, I have no control except over myself and my brother.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:26: He (Allah) said, “This (land) is prohibited to them for forty years.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:27: And recite to them the story of the two sons of ’Ādam rightly: When both of them offered a sacrifice, it was accepted from one of them, and was not accepted from the other.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:28: If you stretch your hand towards me to kill me, I am not going to stretch my hand towards you to kill you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:29: I would rather let you bear my sin and your sin, and then become one of the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:30: His self, however, prompted him to kill his brother, so he killed him and became one of the losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:31: Then, Allah sent a crow that scratched the earth to show him how he should conceal the corpse of his brother.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:32: For this reason, We decreed for the children of Isrā’īl that whoever kills a person not in retaliation for a person killed, nor (as a punishment) for spreading disorder on the earth, is as if he has killed the whole of humankind, and whoever saves the life of a person is as if he has saved the life of the whole of humankind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:33: Those who fight against Allah and His Messenger and run about trying to spread disorder on the earth, their punishment is no other than that they shall be killed, or be crucified, or their hands and legs be cut off from different sides, or they be kept away from the land (they live in).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:34: except those who repent before you overpower them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:35: O you who believe, fear Allah and seek means of nearness to Him, and carry out Jihād in His way, so that you may succeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:36: Surely, if the disbelievers have all that is in the earth, and more as much besides it, to pay it as ransom against the punishment of the Day of Judgment, it shall not be accepted from them, and they will have a painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:37: They will wish to come out of the Fire, but they will not be able to come out from there.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:38: As for a man or a woman who commits theft, cut off the hands of both to punish them for what they earned,-a deterrent punishment from Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:39: Whoever repents after his transgression and corrects himself, then Allah shall relent towards him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:40: Do you not know that to Allah alone belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whomsoever He wills and forgives whomsoever He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:41: O Messenger, those who race towards disbelief should not be a cause of grief for you, be they from those who say with their mouths, “We believe”, while their hearts do not believe, or from those who are (pronounced) Jews.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:42: They are listeners to the fallacy, devourers of the unlawful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:43: How do they ask you to judge while the Torah is with them, having the ruling of Allah? Still, they turn away, after all that.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:44: Surely We have sent down the Torah, in which there was guidance and light by which the prophets, who submitted themselves to Allah, used to judge for the Jews, and (so did) the Men of Allah and the Men of knowledge, because they were ordained to protect the Book of Allah, and they stood guard over it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:45: We prescribed for them therein: A life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear and a tooth for a tooth; and for wounds, an equal retaliation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:46: We sent ‘Īsā son of Maryam after those prophets, confirming the Torah that was (revealed) before him, and We gave him the Injīl having guidance and light therein, and confirming the Torah that was (revealed) before it; a guidance and a lesson for the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:47: And the people of the Injīl must judge according to what Allah has sent down therein.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:48: We have sent down to you the Book with truth, confirming the Book before it, and a protector for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:49: We order you to judge between them according to what Allah has sent down.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:50: Is it, then, the judgement of (the days of) Ignorance that they seek? Who is better in judgement than Allah, for a people who believe?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:51: O you who believe, do not take the Jews and the Christians for intimate friends.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:52: Now, you see those who have disease in their hearts race towards them saying, “We apprehend that some misfortune may overtake us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:53: Those who believe will say, “Are these the ones who swore their solemn oaths by Allah that they were with you?” Their deeds have gone to waste, and they became losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:54: O you who believe, if anyone from you turns back from his Faith, then Allah will bring a people whom He loves and who love Him, humble toward the believers, hard on the disbelievers, who fight in the way of Allah and are not afraid of the reproach of any critic.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:55: Your only friend is Allah, then His Messenger and those who believe, who establish Salāh and pay Zakāh and bow before Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:56: Whoever maintains friendship with Allah and His Messenger and those who believe (must know that) it is the (members of the) Party of Allah that are the triumphant.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:57: O you who believe, do not take those who have taken your Faith in jest and fun for friends from those who have been given the Book prior to you, and the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:58: When you call for Salāh, they take it in jest and fun.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:59: Say, “O People of the Book, do you accuse us of anything else except that we have believed in Allah and in what has been sent down to us and what has been sent down earlier while most of you are sinners (and we do not follow you in your sins)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:60: Say, “Shall I tell you about the ones whose retribution with Allah is worse than that (which you deem bad)? They are those whom Allah has subjected to His curse and to His wrath; and He has turned some of them into apes and swine, those who worshipped Tāghūt (Satan, the Rebel).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:61: When they come to you, they say, “We believe”, while with disbelief they came in, and with the same (disbelief) they went out.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:62: You will see many of them rushing towards sin and aggression, and (towards) devouring what is unlawful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:63: Why do the Men of Allah and the Men of Knowledge not forbid them from saying what is sinful and devouring what is unlawful? Evil indeed is what they have been working.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:64: The Jews said, “Allah’s hand is fettered.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:65: If the People of the Book had believed and feared Allah, We would have written off their evil deeds and would have surely admitted them to the Gardens of Bliss.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:66: If they had upheld the Torah and the Injīl and what had been sent down to them from their Lord, they would surely have had plenty to eat from above them and from beneath them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:67: O Messenger, convey all that has been sent down to you from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:68: Say, “O people of the Book, you have nothing to stand on, unless you uphold the Torah and the Injīl and what has been sent down to you from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:69: Surely, those who believe, and those who are Jews, and the Sabians, and the Christians - whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, and acts righteously, shall have no fear, nor shall such people grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:70: Certainly We took a pledge from the children of Isrā’īl and sent Messengers to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:71: They thought that no harm would follow.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:72: Surely, disbelievers are those who say, “Allah is the MasīH, son of Maryam” while the MasīH had said, “O children of Isrā’īl , worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:73: Surely, disbelievers are those who say, “Allah is the third of the three” while there is no god but One God.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:74: Why then do they not turn to Allah in repentance and seek His forgiveness, while Allah is most forgiving, very merciful?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:75: The MasīH, son of Maryam, is no more than a Messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:76: Say, “Do you worship, besides Allah, what has no power to do you harm or bring you benefit?” Allah is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:77: Say, O people of the Book, be not excessive in your religion unjustly, and do not follow the desires of a people who have already gone astray, misled many and lost the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:78: On those who disbelieve from among the children of Isrā’īl , a curse was pronounced by Dawūd and ‘Īsā, Son of Maryam.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:79: They did not forbid each other from any evil they committed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:80: You see many of them take the infidels (the pagans) for friends.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:81: If they believed in Allah, in the prophet, and in what had been sent down to him, they would have not taken them (the pagans) for friends, but many of them are sinners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:82: And you will certainly find that the people most hostile against the believers are the Jews and the ones who ascribe partners to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:83: When they hear what has been sent down to the Messenger, you will see their eyes overflowing with tears because of the truth they have recognized.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:84: What excuse do we have if we do not believe in Allah and in the truth that has come to us, while we hope that our Lord will admit us to the company of the righteous people?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:85: So, because of what they said, Allah has awarded them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will live forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:86: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs, they are the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:87: O you who believe, do not hold as unlawful the good things that Allah has made lawful for you, and do not transgress.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:88: Eat from what Allah has provided you as good and lawful, and fear Allah in whom you believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:89: Allah does not hold you accountable for your laghw (ineffectual) oaths, but He does hold you accountable for the oath with which you have bound yourself.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:90: O you who believe! Wine, gambling, altars and divining arrows are filth, made up by Satan.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:91: Satan wishes only to plant enmity and malice between you through wine and gambling, and to prevent you from the remembrance of Allah and from Salāh.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:92: Obey Allah, obey the Messenger, and be heedful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:93: There is no sin, for those who believe and do good deeds, in what they might have partaken earlier, if they fear Allah, and believe, and do good deeds; and again fear Allah, and believe, and still again fear Allah and do good deeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:94: O you who believe, Allah shall certainly test you with some of the game coming in the range of your hands and spears, so that Allah may know those who fear Him, even though He is Unseen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:95: O you who believe, do not kill game when you are in IHrām (state of consecration for Hajj or ‘Umrah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:96: Made lawful for you is the game of the sea and eating thereof, as a benefit for you and for travellers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:97: Allah has made the Ka’bah, the Sacred House, a source of stability for people, and also the sacred month and the sacrificial animal and the garlands.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:98: Be sure that Allah is severe in punishment and that Allah is Very-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:99: The duty of Our Messenger is only to convey the Message.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:100: Say, “The evil and the good are not equal, even though the abundance of (what is) evil may attract you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:101: O you who believe, do not ask about things which, if disclosed, would displease you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:102: People before you asked such questions, and then, as a result, became disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:103: Allah has made no BaHīrah, no Sā’ibah, no WaSīlah and no Hāmī (names of animals dedicated to idols on different grounds).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:104: When it is said to them, “Come to what Allah has sent down, and to the Messenger;” they say, “Sufficient for us is that on which we have found our forefathers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:105: O you who believe, take care of your own selves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:106: O you who believe, when death draws near one of you, that is, at the time of making a will, the evidence (recognized) between you shall be of two witnesses from among you, or of two others not from you, if you are travelling on the earth and the trauma of death visits you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:107: Then, if it is discovered that the two had rendered themselves liable to a sin, then, in their place shall stand two others, closest of those whose right has been taken away, and they shall swear by Allah, “Our evidence is more truthful than their evidence, and we have not transgressed; otherwise we should be among the unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:108: Thus, it is more likely that the former people (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:109: (Be mindful of) the day when Allah will assemble the messengers and will say to them, “How were you responded to?” They will say, “We have no knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:110: (Call to mind the time) when Allah will say, “O ‘Īsā, son of Maryam, remember My blessing upon you and upon your mother; when I supported you with the Holy Spirit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:111: When I enjoined upon the disciples (of ‘Īsā ), “Believe in Me and in My Messenger,” they said, “We believed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:112: When the disciples said, “O ‘Īsā, son of Maryam, can your Lord send down to us a repast from the heavens?” He said, “Fear Allah if you are believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:113: They said, “We wish that we eat from it, and our hearts be satisfied, and we may know for sure that you have told us the truth, and we may become witnesses to it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:114: ‘Īsā son of Maryam said, “O Allah, our Lord, send down to us a repast from heaven which may be a happy occasion for us, for all our generations present and future, and a sign from You, and give us provisions.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:115: Allah said, “I am going to send it down to you; but whoever among you disbelieves after that, I shall give him such a punishment as I shall not give to anyone else in all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:116: And when Allah said, “O ‘Īsā, son of Maryam, did you say to the people: ‘Take me and my mother as gods beside Allah?” He said, “Pure are You, it does not behoove me to say what is not right for me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:117: I have not said to them anything but what You have ordered me to say, that is, ‘Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord’ and I was a witness over them as long as I was with them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:118: If You punish them, they are Your slaves after all, but if You forgive them, You are the Mighty, the Wise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:119: Allah will say, “This is a day on which the truth of the truthful shall benefit them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 5:120: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and of whatever lies therein, and He is powerful over everything.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:1: O you who believe, fulfil your bonds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:2: O you who believe, do not profane God's sacraments, nor the sacred month, or the offering, nor the garlands; nor those repairing to the Sacred House, seeking bounty from their Lord, and beatitude.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:3: Forbidden to you is carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and what has been hallowed to other than God, and the beast strangled, and the beast beaten down, and the beast fallen, and the beast gored, and what beasts of prey have devoured - except for what you have sacrificed duly - and what has been sacrificed in idols and that you apportion through the divining of arrows; that is wickedness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:4: They will ask you about what is made lawful for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:5: as hounds, teaching them of what God has taught you; so eat what they have caught for you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:6: Today the good things are permitted to you, and the food of those who were given the Scripture is permitted to you, and permitted to them is your food.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:7: O you who believe, when you stand up to pray wash your faces, and your hands up to the elbows, and wipe your heads, and your feet up to the ankles.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:8: And remember God's grace upon you and His covenant, which He made with you when you said: 'We hear and we obey'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:9: O you who believe, be upright before God, witnesses in equity.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:10: God has promised those who believe and perform righteous deeds: they shall have forgiveness and a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:11: And they who disbelieve and deny Our signs - they shall be the inhabitants of Hell-fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:12: O you who believe, remember God's favour upon you, when a people purposed to extend their hands against you, but He restrained their hands from you; and fear God; and in God let the believers put their trust.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:13: God had made a covenant with the Children of Israel, and We raised up from among them twelve leaders.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:14: So because of their breaking their covenant, We cursed them and made their hearts hard; they pervert words from their contexts; and they have forgotten a portion of what they were reminded of; and you will never cease to discover some treachery on their part, except for a few of them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:15: And with those who say: 'We are Christians', We made a covenant, and they have forgotten a portion of that they were reminded of.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:16: O People of the Scripture, now there has come to you Our Messenger, making clear to you much of what you used to conceal of the Scripture, and pardoning much.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:17: whereby God guides whoever follows His good pleasure to the ways of peace, and brings them forth from the shadows into the light by His leave, and He guides them to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:18: They indeed are disbelievers those who say, 'God is the Messiah, son of Mary'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:19: The Jews and Christians say: 'We are the sons of God and His beloved ones'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:20: O People of the Scripture, there has verily come to you Our Messenger, making clear to you, after an interval between the messengers; lest you should say: 'There has not come to us any bearer of good tidings nor any warner'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:21: And when Moses said to his people, 'O my people, remember God's favour to you, when He established among you prophets, and established you as kings, and gave you such as He had not given to any in all the worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:22: O my people, enter the Holy Land which God has ordained for you, and do not turn back in flight, or you will end up as losers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:23: They said, 'O Moses, there are giants in it; we will never enter it until they depart from it; if they depart from it then we will enter'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:24: There said two men of those who feared to whom God had been gracious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:25: They said, 'O Moses, we will never enter it so long as they are in it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:26: He said, 'My Lord, I control none but myself and my brother.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:27: He said: 'Then it shall be forbidden them for forty years; they shall wander lost in the land; so do not grieve for the wicked folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:28: And recite to them the story of the two sons of Adam, truthfully, how they each offered a sacrifice, and it was accepted from one of them, and not accepted from the other.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:29: 'Yet if you extend your hand against me to slay me, I will not extend my hand against you to slay you; I fear God, the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:30: I desire that you should end up with my sin, and your own sin, and so become an inhabitant of the Fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:31: Then his soul prompted him to slay his brother, so he slew him and became one of the losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:32: Then God sent forth a raven, scratching into the earth to show him how he might hide the nakedness of his brother.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:33: Because of that, We decreed for the Children of Israel that whoever slays a soul for other than a soul, or for corruption in the land, it shall be as if he had slain mankind altogether; and whoever saves the life of one, it shall be as if he had saved the life of all mankind.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:34: Truly the only requital of those who fight against God and His Messenger, and hasten about the earth to do corruption there is that they shall be slaughtered, or crucified, or have their hands and feet cut off on opposite sides, or be banished from the land.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:35: Except for such as repent before you overpower them; for know that God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:36: O you who believe, fear God, and seek the means to Him, and struggle in His way so that you might prosper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:37: Truly, as for the disbelievers, if they possessed all that is in the earth, and the like of it with it, by which to ransom themselves from the chastisement of the Day of Resurrection, it would not be accepted from them; theirs shall be a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:38: They will desire to exit from the Fire, but they will not exit from it; theirs shall be a lasting chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:39: And the thieving male and the thieving female cut off their hands as a requital for what they have earned, and an exemplary punishment from God; God is Mighty, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:40: But whoever repents after his evildoing and amends, God will relent to him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:41: Do you not know that to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? He chastises whom He wills and forgives whom He wills, and God has power over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:42: O Messenger, let them not grieve you those who vie with one another in disbelief, such as say with their mouths, 'We believe' but their hearts do not believe; and from among those of Jewry, who listen to calumny, listening to other folk who have not co me to you; perverting words from their contexts, saying, 'If you are given this, then take it; but if you are not given it, then beware!' Whomever God desires to try, you cannot avail him anything against God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:43: Listeners to calumny and consumers of unlawful gain.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:44: But how is it that they make you their judge when they have the Torah, wherein is God's judgement; and then they turn away, after that? Such are not believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:45: Surely We revealed the Torah, wherein is guidance, and light by which the prophets, who had submitted, judged for those of Jewry, as did the rabbis, and the priests, according to that which they were bidden to observe of God's Scripture and were witnesses to.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:46: And therein We prescribed for them that a life for a life, and an eye for an eye, and a nose for a nose, and an ear for an ear, and a tooth for a tooth; and for wounds retaliation; but whoever forgoes it out of charity, then that shall be an expiation for him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:47: And We caused Jesus son of Mary to follow in their footsteps, confirming the Torah before him; and We gave to him the Gospel, wherein is guidance and light, confirming the Torah before it, and as a guidance and an admonition to the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:48: So let the People of the Gospel judge according to what God has revealed therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:49: And We have revealed to you the Book with the truth confirming the Book that was before it and watching over it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:50: And judge between them according to what God has revealed, and do not follow their whims, and beware of them lest they seduce you from part of what God has revealed to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:51: Do they desire the judgement of paganism.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:52: O you who believe, do not take Jews and Christians as patrons; they are patrons of each other.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:53: And you see those in whose hearts is sickness, vying with one another for them, saying: 'We fear lest we suffer a turn of fortune'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:54: And they say, those who believe: 'Are these the ones who swore by God their most earnest oaths that they were surely with you? Their works have failed; and they have become the losers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:55: O you who believe, whoever of you apostatises from his religion, God will assuredly bring a people whom He loves and who love Him: humble, towards believers, stern towards disbelievers, struggling in the way of God, and fearing not the reproach of any reproacher.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:56: Your patron is God only, and His Messenger, and the believers who establish prayer and pay the alms, bowing down.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:57: Whoever affiliates with God and His Messenger and the believers; for verily the party of God, they are the victors.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:58: O you who believe, do not take as patrons those who take your religion in mockery, and as a game, from among those who were given the Scripture before you and [from among] the disbelievers and fear God if you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:59: And when you make the call to prayer, take it in mockery and as a game; that is because they are a people who do not understand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:60: Say: 'O People of the Scripture, do you spite us for any other cause than that we believe in God, and what has been revealed to us, and what was revealed before, and that most of you are wicked?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:61: Say: 'Shall I tell you of what is worse than that by way of reward from God? Those whom God has cursed and with whom He is wroth, and some of whom He has turned into apes and swine, and worship the false deity.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:62: When they come to you, they say, 'We believe'; but they have entered in disbelief, and so they have departed in it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:63: And you see many of them vying in sin and enmity, and their consuming of unlawful gain; evil is that which they have been committing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:64: Why do the rabbis and the priests not forbid them from uttering sin and consuming unlawful gain? Evil is what they have been doing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:65: The Jews said: 'God's hand is fettered'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:66: But had the People of the Scripture believed and feared, We would have absolved them of their evil deeds and We would admitted them to Gardens of Bliss.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:67: And had they observed the Torah and the Gospel, and what was revealed to them from their Lord, they would surely have received nourishment from above them and from beneath their feet.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:68: O Messenger, make known that which has been revealed to you from your Lord, for if you do not, you will not have conveyed His Message.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:69: Say: 'O People of the Scripture, you have no basis until you observe the Torah and the Gospel and what was revealed to you from your Lord'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:70: Surely those who believe and those of Jewry, and the Sabaeans, and the Christians: whoever believes in God and the Last Day and behaves righteously — no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:71: And We made a covenant with the Children of Israel, and We sent messengers to them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:72: And they thought there would be no trial; and so they were wilfully blind and deaf.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:73: They indeed are disbelievers those who say, 'Indeed God is the Messiah, son of Mary'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:74: They are indeed disbelievers those who say, 'God is the third of three', when there is no god but the One God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:75: Will they not turn in repentance to God and seek His forgiveness?; God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:76: The Messiah, son of Mary, was only a messenger; messengers passed away before him; his mother was a truthful woman; they both used to eat food.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:77: Say: 'Do you worship besides God what cannot hurt or profit you? God is the Hearer, the Knower'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:78: Say: 'O People of the Scripture, do not go to extremes in your religion, other than those of truth, and do not follow the whims of a people who went astray formerly, and have led many astray, and strayed from the even way'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:79: Cursed were the disbelievers of the Children of Israel by the tongue of David and by Jesus, son of Mary; that was because of their disobedience and their transgression.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:80: They did not prevent one another any indecency that they committed; verily evil was what they used to do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:81: You see many of them affiliating with those who disbelieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:82: Yet had they believed in God and the Prophet, and what has been revealed to him, they would not have affiliated with them; but many of them are wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:83: You will truly find the most hostile of people to those who believe to be the Jews and the idolaters; and you will truly find the nearest of them in love to those who believe to be those who say 'Verily, we are Christians'; that because some of them are priests and monks, and because they are not disdainful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:84: And when they hear what has been revealed to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflow with tears because of what they recognise of the truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:85: And why should we not believe in God and what has come to us of the truth, and hope that our Lord should admit us with the righteous people?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:86: So God has rewarded them for what they have said with Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide; that is the requital of those who are virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:87: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - they are the inhabitants of Hell-fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:88: O you who believe, do not forbid the good things that God has made lawful for you and do not transgress; God does not love transgressors.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:89: And eat of the lawful and good food which God has provided you; and fear God, in Whom you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:90: God will not take you to task for a slip in your oaths, but He will take you to task for that to which you have pledged oaths; the expiation thereof is the feeding of ten of the needy of the midmost food you feed your families, or the clothing of them, or the setting free of a slave; and whoever does not find the means, then the fasting of three days.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:91: O you who believe, verily wine, and games of chance, and idols, and divinatory arrows are an abomination of Satan's work; so avoid it, so that you might prosper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:92: Satan desires only to precipitate enmity and hatred between you through wine and games of chance and to bar you from the remembrance of God and from prayer.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:93: And obey God and obey the Messenger, and beware; but if you turn away, then know that Our Messenger's duty is only to proclaim plainly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:94: Those who believe and perform righteous deeds are not at fault in what they may have consumed, so long as they fear, and believed and performed righteous deeds, and then were God-fearing and believed, and then were God-fearing and virtuous; God loves the virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:95: O you who believe, God will surely try you with some game, which will be caught by your hands and your lances, so that God may know who fears Him in the Unseen.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:96: O you who believe, do not slay game while you are in the state of pilgrimage inviolability; whoever of you slays it wilfully, then the compensation shall be the equivalent of what he has slain, of flocks, to be judged by two just men among you, an offering to reach the Ka’ba.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:97: Permitted to you is the game of the sea and food from it is a provision for you and for the wayfarers; but forbidden to you is the hunting of game on the land, so long as you remain in pilgrimage inviolability; and fear God, to whom you shall be gathered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:98: God has appointed the Ka’ba, the Sacred House as an
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:99: institution for mankind, and the sacred month, the offering and the garlands; that is so that you may know that God knows all that is in the heavens and in the earth, and that God has knowledge of all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:100: Know that God is severe in punishment and that God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:101: The duty of the Messenger is only to convey [the Message], and God knows what you reveal and what you hide.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:102: Say: 'The evil and the good are not equal, even though the abundance of the evil attract you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:103: O you who believe, do not ask about things which, if disclosed to you would trouble you; yet if you ask about them while the Qur’ān is being revealed, they will be disclosed to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:104: Verily a people before you asked about them, and then they disbelieved in them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:105: God has not ordained anything such as a Bahīra, a Sā’iba, a Wasīla or a Hām, but the disbelievers invent lies against God; and most of them do not understand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:106: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what God has revealed and to the Messenger, they say, 'What we have found our fathers following suffices us'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:107: O you who believe, you are responsible for your own souls; he who is astray cannot hurt you, if you are rightly guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:108: O you who believe, let testimony between you, when death draws near to one of you, at the time of a bequest, be that of two men of justice among you, or of two others from another folk, if you are travelling in the land and the affliction of death befalls you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:109: But if it be discovered that both of them have merited [the suspicion of] sin, then two others shall take their place, being the nearest of those most concerned, and they shall swear by God, 'Verily, our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed, for then we would assuredly be among the evildoers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:110: That [makes it] likelier that they will bear the testimony in its true form, or that they will be afraid that after their oaths other oaths may be taken.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:111: The day when God shall gather the messengers, and He will say: 'What answer were you given?'; they shall say, 'We have no knowledge; You, only You, are the Knower of things unseen'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:112: When God said, 'O Jesus, son of Mary, remember My favour to you and to your mother, when I strengthened you with the Holy Spirit to speak to people in the cradle and in maturity and when I taught you the Scripture, and wisdom, and the Torah, and the Gospel; and how you create out of clay the likeness of a bird by My permission, and you breathe into it and it becomes a bird by My permission, and you heal the blind and the leper by My permission, and you raise the dead by My permission; and how I restrained the Children of Israel from you, when you brought them clear proofs, and the disbelievers among them said, "This is nothing but manifest sorcery".
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:113: And when I revealed to the disciples: "Believe in Me and in My Messenger", they said, "We believe; bear witness that we have submitted" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:114: When the disciples said, 'O Jesus, son of Mary, is your Lord able to send down on us a Table from the heaven?' He said: 'Fear God if you are believers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:115: They said, 'We desire to eat of it and that our hearts be reassured, and that we may know that you have spoken truthfully to us, and that we may be among the witnesses thereof'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:116: Jesus, son of Mary, said: 'O God, our Lord, send down upon us a Table from the heaven, that it shall be a celebration for us for the first and the last of us and a sign from You.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:117: God said, 'Verily I shall send it down to you; but whoever of you disbelieves afterward, I shall surely chastise him with a chastisement wherewith I chastise no other being from among all the worlds'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:118: And when God says, 'O Jesus, son of Mary, did you say to mankind, "Take me and my mother as gods, besides God?" ' He says, 'Glory be to You! It is not mine to say what I have no right to.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:119: I only said to them that which You commanded me, “Worship God, my Lord and your Lord”.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:120: If you chastise them, verily they are Your servants, and if You forgive them, You, only You, are the Mighty, the Wise'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:121: God says, 'This is the day those who were truthful shall profit by their truthfulness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 5:122: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is in them; and He has power over all things.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:2: O believers! Do not denigrate the signs of Allah, nor the sacred (and venerable) month (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:3: Forbidden to you is carrion (the animal that dies and is not slaughtered according to Islamic law) and (the discharged) blood and pork and that (animal) on which the name of someone other than Allah has been invoked whilst slaughtering and (the animal) that dies by strangling or by a violent blow (not by any sharp instrument) or by falling from a height or the one that has been gored to death or which has been ripped apart and gnawed by a wild beast, save the one which you slaughter (before it dies), and (that animal too is forbidden) which has been slaughtered on idolatrous altars (dedicated to false gods).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:5: People ask you what has been made lawful for them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:6: This day, good and pure things have been made lawful for you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:7: O believers! When (you intend) to stand for Prayer, then, (for ablution,) wash your faces and hands up to the elbows, and pass your wet hands over your heads and (also wash) your feet up to the ankles.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:8: And call to mind the favour of Allah (conferred) upon you, and (also recall) the promise which He took from you (under affirmation) when you declared (agreeing): ‘We heard (Allah’s command) and we obeyed (it).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:9: O believers! Holding fast to the cause of Allah, bear witness based on justice.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:10: Allah has promised forgiveness and a mighty reward for those who believe and persist in piety and righteous actions.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:11: But those who disbelieve and deny Our Revelations, they are the people who will be (on fire) in Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:12: O believers! Call to mind the favour of Allah (which) was bestowed upon you when a people (who disbelieved) resolved to stretch out their hands against you (for killing and destruction) but Allah held back their hands from you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:13: And indeed, Allah took a firm promise from the Children of Israel, and We appointed amongst them twelve chieftains (for its fulfilment, enforcement and protection).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:14: I will certainly remove your sins from you, and will assuredly admit you to the Gardens with streams flowing beneath.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:15: Then We laid Our curse on them because of their breach of promise (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:16: And We (also) took a (similar) promise from those who say: ‘We are Christians.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:17: O People of the Book! Indeed, there has come to you Our Messenger who (clearly) unfolds to you many such things from the Book as you have been concealing and who overlooks many of (your) wrongs (too).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:18: By this Allah guides those who seek His pleasure to the paths to peace (and security), and takes them out of darkness (of ignorance and disbelief) by His command, and leads them to the light (of faith and guidance), and directs them towards the straight road.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:19: They have indeed committed disbelief who say: ‘Verily, Allah is (but) the Messiah, the son of Maryam (Mary).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:20: And the Jews and the Christians say: ‘We are the sons of Allah and His beloved ones.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:21: O People of the Book! Indeed, Our (Last) Prophet has come to you (at the juncture) when (the chain of) Messengers’ succession is breaking off, and he expounds to you (Our commands and injunctions) with ample clarity, (because) you may (by way of excuse) say: ‘There has come to us no Bearer of good news or a Warner.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:22: And (recall) when Musa (Moses) said to his people: ‘O my people! Recollect the blessing Allah (bestowed) upon you when He raised Prophets from amongst you, and made you kings and gave (so) much to you as He had not given to anyone else in all the worlds (in your contemporary period).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:23: O my people! Enter the holy land (of Syria or Bayt al-Maqdis )
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:24: which Allah has decreed for you, and do not turn back (in retreat), or you will turn back as losers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:25: They said (in reply): ‘O Musa (Moses)! There are mighty (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:26: Two men from amongst (a few) who feared (Allah) and whom Allah had favoured with His Blessing (said to their folk:) ‘Enter the gate (of the city invading) these people (dauntlessly).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:27: They said: ‘O Musa (Moses)! Never shall we enter this (land) so long as they are in it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:29: submitted: ‘My Lord! I have no control (over anyone) except for myself and my brother (Harun ).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:30: So put us apart from (these) wicked people (by Your command).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:31: (The Lord) said: ‘So this (land) is forbidden to these (rebels) for forty years.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:32: over the (warning plight) of these disobedient and unruly people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:33: (O Most Esteemed Messenger!) Relate to these people the account of the two sons of Adam (Habil and Qabil [Abel and Cain]) which is absolutely true.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:34: was accepted, whilst that from the other (Qabil )
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:36: If you stretch forth your hand against me to kill me, (even then) I shall not stretch out my hand against you in order to kill you because I fear Allah, the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:37: I want (I commit no offence and) you take my sin (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:38: Then the (ill-commanding) self of Qabil (Cain) made the killing of his brother Habil (Abel) easy (and tempting) for him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:39: Then Allah sent a crow that started scratching the earth to show him how to hide his brother’s corpse.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:40: On account of this, We prescribed (this commandment in the Torah sent down) to the Children of Israel that whoever killed a person (unjustly), except as a punishment for murder or for (spreading) disorder in the land, it would be as if he killed all the people (of society); and whoever (saved him from unjust murder and) made him survive, it would be as if he saved the lives of all the people (of society, i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:41: Indeed, those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) and remain engaged in creating mischief in the land (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 5:42: Except those who turn to Allah in repentance before you overpower them.
